column4: btw wilee-nilee whoever supplied the infobot the that nick completion factoid should change the the spelling to nick , not nic
we are lucky it kis not in leet
not for me but it might be for some , wilee-nilee , afterall spelling is important to those whose english not as good as it could be.
That's his fdisk it is a gpt
You would have to chroot into the install to install there
are you sure , /dev/sda4 is his ubuntu install , why bothger with chrooting ?
he's using the live cd with the terminal
From a live cd you would have to chroot. As it is he can boot to Ubuntu I believe you can you purge and install all from there.
It is a GPT it is not  msdos partitioning set up, Personally I think a person who know GPT booting wu=ith grub will know what to do.
I never do chroots to install grub to a different partition
Cool but I doubt that will fix it but one never knows. I never of had to reload a grub this way.
I believe GPT can work with grub fine it just needs someone who knows this stuff.
I wonder if this would have worked for Arcanewater , http://www.wensley.org.uk/gpt

Not sure to be honest there are official ubuntu wiki's on this stuff.  I spent a long time on the UF helping with grub issues and dualbooting stuff, there were a couple of helpers there who knew this part of it and were on daily, so I let them mess with the unusual partitioning stuff, lol.
here is one of the best helpers there. http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=11509699&postcount=2
it looks like grub devs better get a handle this if we're going to see more and more pcs with GPT tables
I think they do it is just not a click and play situation.
